statements.name: PROC PYTHON
statements.description: Runs Python statements within a SAS session.
statements.help:
Submit a block of Python codePROC PYTHON 
                        <INFILE='file-name' | fileref>
                        <RESTART>
                        <TERMINATE>
                        <TIMEOUT=n>;
	<SUBMIT;>
                              
		 Python statements                                     
                        
                        
	<ENDSUBMIT;>                         RUN;Submit Python code interactivelyPROC PYTHON 
                        <INFILE='file-name' | fileref>
                        <ECHO>
                        <RESTART>
                        <TERMINATE>
                        <TIMEOUT=n>;
	<INTERACTIVE;>
                              
		 Python statements, submitted                                           interactively
                        
                        
	<ENDINTERACTIVE;>                         RUN;

arguments.name: ECHO
arguments.description: specifies that interactively submitted lines of Python code should be included in the SAS log.

arguments.name: INFILE=
arguments.description: identifies a source file or fileref that contains Python statements to run within a SAS session.

arguments.name: RESTART
arguments.description: terminates a PYTHON subprocess if one is running currently, and creates a new subprocess.

arguments.name: TERMINATE
arguments.description: stops the PYTHON subprocess when the current PYTHON procedure call completes. The next call to the PYTHON procedure begins a new instance of the PYTHON subprocess.

arguments.name: TIMEOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the number of seconds that can elapse before PROC PYTHON terminates when attempting to connect to a Python environment.

statements.name: SUBMIT
statements.description: Identifies the beginning of a block of Python code. Enter Python statements between the SUBMIT and ENDSUBMIT statements.

statements.name: ENDSUBMIT
statements.description: Specified on a line by itself, this statement identifies the end of a block of Python statements.

statements.name: INTERACTIVE
statements.description: Identifies the beginning of Python code that you submit interactively.

statements.name: ENDINTERACTIVE
statements.description: Specified on a line by itself, this statement identifies the end of Python code that you submit interactively.
